title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Collections
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Collections               Collections       Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site's collection consists of the items located in the Research Library and a doll used in the Kenneth and Mamie Clark studies which were crucial evidence for the case. Other physical items are limited mainly to documents which are of public record or held in private collections.   Local collections include:  Charles S. Scott, Attorney at the University of Kansas Court decisions
